materials.raw_text:
Cerium oxide (Ce2O3) - 30 g 
 Copper (Cu) - 20 g 
 Silicon (Si) - 60 g 
 Samarium oxide (Sm2O3) - 10 g 
 Flux (Sodium borate, Na2B4O7) - 5 g 
 Binder (Polyvinyl alcohol) - 2 g

sourcing.instructions:
Cerium oxide can be sourced from chemical suppliers or online platforms like Sigma-Aldrich. 
 Copper can be obtained from metal supply stores or online retailers. 
 Silicon can be found in electronics supply stores or online. 
 Samarium oxide is available from specialized chemical suppliers. 
 Flux can be sourced from glass-making suppliers or chemical providers. 
 Polyvinyl alcohol can be purchased from craft stores or online sellers.

preparation.raw_text:
1. Weigh the required amounts of each ingredient accurately. 
 2. In a clean, dry glass container, combine 30 g of cerium oxide, 20 g of copper, 60 g of silicon, 10 g of samarium oxide, 5 g of sodium borate, and 2 g of polyvinyl alcohol. 
 3. Mix the powders thoroughly using a spatula or a mechanical mixer until a uniform mixture is achieved.
